      • setElementContentWithUnsafetyText

        public static void setElementContentWithUnsafetyText(org.w3c.dom.Element el,
                                                     java.lang.String content)
        Common way to save any XML Element Text Content. Desired Element text content can contain non Valid XML chars. In this case text content is encoded with base64 and element receive corresponding attribute value.
        Parameters:
        el - Element
        content - String

      • getElementContentWithUnsafetyText

        public static java.lang.String getElementContentWithUnsafetyText(org.w3c.dom.Node el,
                                                                 java.util.ResourceBundle bundle,
                                                                 boolean transferEncode)
        Common way to read text content of XML Element. If it has attribute 'contentType' with value 'base64' then text content is being decoded from base64 encoding.
        Parameters:
        el - Node
        Returns:
        String
        See Also:
        setElementContentWithUnsafetyText(org.w3c.dom.Element, byte[])

      • readDataTableFromNode

        public static DataTable readDataTableFromNode(org.w3c.dom.Node dtNode,
                                              XMLEncodingSettings settings)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Reading DataTable from DOM node object. If DOM node contains no 'format' section then resulting TableFormat should be set to givenFormat if it is not null. Otherwise exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        dtNode - Node
        settings - XMLEncodingSettings
        Returns:
        DataTable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        Returns:
        Document
        Throws:
        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException
